catalog_info.title: Medicine, Law, and Ethics: An Introduction
catalog_info.prereq: Course open to Freshman Students Only
catalog_info.description: Explores medical, legal, and ethical aspects of medical care, with particular attention to medical decision-making at the beginning and end of life, participants in research on human subjects, human reproductive technologies, mental illness, and experimentation on animals. Historical background of present-day medical practices and relevant law to be discussed.
